info.title: hl2 Panorama API
info.description:
# Introduction

Welcome to the hl2 Panorama API specification. We will commit ourselves to support the library and maintain backwards compatibility in the future, but we reserve the right to make incompatible changes when necessary. If you experience any issues, please contact support.

# Pagination

## Parameters
 Some endpoints that return multiple items will be paginated to `10` items by default.You can change this limit with the `limit` parameter.

You can request further pages with the `page` parameter. Note that page numbering is 1-based and that omitting the page parameter will return the first page.
## Link header
The `Link` response header, if returned, includes pagination information and one or more hypermedia link relations. The possible values are
* `prev`: The link relation for the previous page of results
* `next`: The link relation for the next page of results
* `last`: The link relation for the last page of results
## X-Total-Count header
The `X-Total-Count` response header, if returned, contains the total number of results in all pages for the current GET request. If it is not returned, the response contains all the possible results.

# Requests Limits 

## Size Limiting
 The maximum payload size for each request is 1 MB. Once you go over the size limit you will receive an `HTTP/1.1 413 Payload too large` error response.
## Rate Limiting
You can make up to `20` requests per second to each API endpoint.

For public endpoints, requests are associated with your IP address. Once you are authenticated, requests are associated with your API key

 You can check the returned HTTP headers of any API request to see your current rate limit status. Once you go over the rate limit you will receive an `HTTP/1.1 429 Too Many Requests` error response.

* `X-RateLimit-Limit`: Number of requests that the consumer is permitted to make per second
* `X-RateLimit-Remaining`: Number of requests remaining in the current rate limit window
* `X-RateLimit-Reset`: Remaining time until the number of requests is reset

get.description: List all the active accounts of the hl2 Panorama platform, or search for one using their `name` or `username`. This is useful to figure out their IDs to add them to your organization using the `Add member` endpoint.
Get the details for one of your organization’s applications.

put.description: Update one of your organization’s applications.

delete.description: Delete one of your organization’s applications.

get.description: List the devices linked to one of your organization’s applications.

put.description: Add a device to one of your organization’s applications. If the device was already linked to the application, behaves as though it has just been added (no error, 204 response code).

delete.description: Remove a device from the specified application.

get.description: List all the application alerts for one of your organization’s applications.

post.description: Create an application alert for one of your organization’s applications.

get.description: List all the application hooks for one of your organization’s applications.

post.description: Create an application hook for one of your organization’s applications.

get.description: Get the list of “deliveries” for an application hook, that is the history of all the times the hook was called, with the payload sent to and the response received from the hook URL.
Get the details for a device registered with your organization.

put.description: Update the details for a device registered with your organization.

delete.description: Remove the device from your organization. This will not be possible if the device is linked to any application, or if it has active routes.

get.description: List the applications for your organization.

post.description: Create a new application for your organization.

get.description: List all the devices registered with your organization.

parameters.name: productId
parameters.description: The device product ID to search for.

parameters.name: hasProduct
parameters.description: Either `true` to filter devices with a product, or `false` to disable this filter.

post.description: Register a device with your organization.

get.description: List all users who are members of your organization.

put.description: Add a member to your organization, or update an existing member.

delete.description: Remove a member from your organization. This will also remove the member from all the organization’s teams and they will no longer have access to any of the organization’s resources.

get.description: List the products for your organization. Public products not owned by your organization are not listed.

post.description: Create a product for your organization.
Create a team for your organization.

get.description: List all the public products, whether they belong to your organization or not.
Get the details of one of your organization’s products, or of a public product not owned by your organization.

put.description: Update one of your organization’s products.

delete.description: Delete one of your organization’s products. This will only be possible if the product is neither public nor used by any device.

get.description: Get the details of one of your organization’s teams.

put.description: Update the details of one of your organization’s teams.

delete.description: Delete one of your organization’s teams.

get.description: List the applications of one of your organization’s teams.

put.summary: Add or update a team application
put.description: Add an application to one of your organization’s teams, or change the team application’s permission.

delete.description: Remove an application from one of your organization’s teams.

get.description: List members of the specified team.

put.description: Add a member to the team. If the member was already in the team, behaves as though it has just been added.

delete.description: Remove a member from one of your organization’s teams. The member is still part of your organization, but no longer has access to the resources shared by the team.

limit.name: limit
limit.description: The number of items to be returned by page
